p: Coronaviruses are enveloped viruses with a characteristic spike protein inserted into the outer membrane.Their non-fragmented single-stranded RNA genomes with plus strand orientation are about 26–32 kb long and they host seven to ten different open reading frames (ORF) [ 9, 10]. Coronaviruses have 26 known species, including α、β、γ、δ, categorized based on sequence comparisons of entire viral genomes. There are a total of four genera, of which only α and β are disease-causing in humans [ 11, 46].
